title: Serco hires stretch limo for asylum seekers
text: gruffalo said: No we can not assume that this was not at a loss to Serco.Do you really think that the home office really negotiate contracts on a journey by journey or day be day basis?Of course they don't this would be within a fixed price contract and the cost of the limo was less that the penalty for missing their SLA within the contract, a simple business decision to take when something has gone wrong, you ask your self "what is the cheapest way round this." if the penalty is £500 take that if it is £5000 and a limo costs £3000 you take that route round the problem.Not even news worthy just the press trying to get people foaming at the mouth. i am coming to the conclusion there are quite a few people on here that are part of the ludicrous bureaucracy that is slowly but surely fking up this country. is it a prerequisite that uk public service employees and or contractors have the commonsense brain cell removed before they are hired .
